chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth L. Risch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to comply with the sex offender registry and any treatment and assessment recommended by probation.  Defendant shall also attend any other counseling as recommended by probation.  Defendant shall have no contact with the victim and/or victim's parents.  It is up to probation whether defendant shall provide an apology to the victim and/or victim's parent in a mode and manner to be determined by probation.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections.  If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution was paid from defendant's bond.
Court costs were previously paid from defendant's bond.

Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant shall comply with the sex offender registry.  Defendant shall undergo a sex offender assessment and comply with any treatment recommendations.   Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

Defendant shall have no contact with the victim.  Defendant shall have no contact with any juvenile females. 
Court order dated September 13, 2018 - Defendant shall be allowed supervised contact with his juvenile daughter at the discretion of his agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 11, 2018 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Kenneth L. Risch in court, in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Risch wrote a letter to the court requesting that his bond be modified.  Attorney Tlusty indicated that he is not on bond in this case.  He is currently in our jail waiting a revocation of his case. Court indicated to the defendant that there is no bond to set as he is on a revocation hold through probation.  Mr. Risch is waiting for the public defender's office to appoint counsel to represent him.- rt

Restitution Summary
DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

DA Tlusty, Attorney Justin Wolff, Kenneth Risch-defendant, Amy Merrill -VW Coordinator,
Plea Questionnaire presented to the court.  In 14CF9 - charge will be amended to 948.02(2) class C felony, defendant enters plea of no contest to the amended charge;  In 14CM6- plea of no contest to ct 1 as filed.   Court addresses defendant regarding his rights and plea. Court finds defendant enters plea freely and voluntarily to the amended charge of 948.02(2) in 14 CF 9 and in 14 CM 6 to count 1 as filed;  Court finds factual basis exists for the plea and def understands the proceeding and his rights.  Court is satisfied he committed the charge;  14CF09 convicted of charge as amended 948.02(2), In 14 CM 6 convicted of sexual grat w/animal as a repeater.  In 14 CF 9 the  court withholds sentence probation for 8 years with conditions of 12 months county jail with huber to begin no later than January 19, 2015 at 4:30 p.m. comply with sex offender registry any treatment and assessment as recommended by probation; restitution; costs; provide DNA sample and surcharge; no contact with the victim; up to the agent whether you would provide an apology to the victim and/or parents.  In 14CM6 the court withholds sentence probation for one year concurrent with the felony case conditions of 2 months county jail consecutive to  14CF9 with huber; restitution; court costs no possession of any domesticated animals during term of probation.  No sentence credit; if it is later determined that there is credit we can have a hearing and make adjustment; appeal rights given to defendant.
by A.L.G.
to J.M.C.
and Certificate of Appearance for J.M.C.
and Certificate of Appearance for A.L.G.
